name: Permissions Policy Header Not Set
desc: Permissions Policy Header is an added layer of security that helps to restrict from unauthorized access or usage of browser/client features by web resources. This policy ensures the user privacy by limiting or specifying the features of the browsers can be used by the web resources. Permissions Policy provides a set of standard HTTP headers that allow website owners to limit which features of browsers can be used by the page such as camera\, microphone\, location\, full screen etc.
solution: Ensure that your web server\, application server\, load balancer\, etc. is configured to set the Permissions-Policy header.
